question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: find_function_def_by_name()] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker craft a module with duplicate function names causing find_function_def_by_name() to return the wrong function definition, leading to incorrect bytecode patching that bypasses security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: find_function_def_by_name()] [Memory Safety] Does find_function_def_by_name() properly validate the function_defs array bounds when returning mutable references, or could out-of-bounds access occur if the module structure is corrupted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: find_function_def_by_name()] [Logic Error] Can a malicious module with specially crafted identifier tables cause find_function_def_by_name() to match the wrong function, allowing governance bypass through incorrect patching? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add()] [Integer Overflow] In get_or_add(), can the pool.len() result overflow when cast to u16 in get_or_add_addr() or get_or_add_ident(), causing index corruption and module verification bypass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker cause unbounded growth of identifier/address pools through repeated get_or_add() calls, leading to memory exhaustion and denial of service during simulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add_addr()] [Index Overflow] Does get_or_add_addr() properly validate that pool.len() fits in u16 before casting to AddressIdentifierIndex, or can overflow lead to incorrect module indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add_ident()] [Index Overflow] In get_or_add_ident(), can casting pool.len() to u16 overflow when adding many identifiers, causing IdentifierIndex corruption and module verification failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add_signature()] [Index Overflow] Does get_or_add_signature() check for u16 overflow when creating SignatureIndex from pool length, potentially corrupting signature references? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add_module_handle()] [Handle Injection] Can get_or_add_module_handle() be exploited to inject malicious module handles that reference system modules, bypassing access control checks during simulation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: get_or_add_module_handle()] [Index Corruption] Does get_or_add_module_handle() properly validate ModuleHandleIndex bounds when casting pool.len() to u16, or can overflow corrupt module references? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: find_function_handle_by_name()] [Name Collision] Can find_function_handle_by_name() be tricked by crafted modules with colliding function names at different addresses, returning wrong function handles? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: find_function_handle_by_name()] [Index Validation] Does find_function_handle_by_name() validate that the returned FunctionHandleIndex(idx as u16) doesn't overflow, potentially causing incorrect function resolution? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: add_simple_native_function()] [Privilege Escalation] Can add_simple_native_function() be exploited to inject arbitrary native functions into modules, allowing execution of privileged operations that bypass Move safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: add_simple_native_function()] [Signature Mismatch] Does add_simple_native_function() validate that injected native function signatures match expected types, or can type confusion lead to memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: add_simple_native_function()] [Duplicate Injection] If add_simple_native_function() finds an existing function handle, does it verify the signature matches before returning, or can signature mismatches cause type safety violations? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: add_simple_native_function()] [Visibility Bypass] The injected function has Visibility::Private - can this be exploited if the function should have different visibility, bypassing access control in governance scripts? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: add_simple_native_function()] [Function Table Overflow] Does add_simple_native_function() check if function_handles.len() fits in u16 before creating FunctionHandleIndex, preventing index overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: add_simple_native_function()] [Code Injection] Since the injected function has code: None (native), can an attacker later replace it with malicious bytecode to execute arbitrary logic? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_module()] [Module Verification Bypass] Does patch_module() use move_bytecode_verifier::verify_module() with sufficient strictness, or can carefully crafted patches bypass verification while still being exploitable? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_module()] [State Corruption] Can patch_module() cause state corruption if the modify_module callback fails halfway through modifications but some changes were already applied to the mutable CompiledModule? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_module()] [Race Condition] If multiple threads call patch_module() concurrently on the same module_id, can race conditions in state_view.get_module()/add_module() lead to inconsistent module state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_module()] [Module Not Found] When patch_module() receives None from get_module(), it returns an error - but could this be exploited by timing attacks to prevent critical security patches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_module()] [Verification Gaps] Does move_bytecode_verifier::verify_module() check all security invariants, or are there unchecked properties that attackers can exploit in patched modules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_module()] [Module Replacement] Can patch_module() replace critical system modules with malicious versions that maintain verification but change execution behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/simulate.rs] [Function: patch_aptos_governance()] [Governance Bypass] The patch_aptos_governance() function completely bypasses governance by replacing resolve_multi_step_proposal - can this be exploited if simulation results are mistakenly used in production? (Critical)
